title: Authorizes the use of surplus funds from the greater Catskills flood remediation program by Ulster county
summary: Authorizes the use of surplus funds from the greater Catskills flood remediation program by Ulster county.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          125

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CAHILL, P. LOPEZ -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Housing

       AN  ACT  to amend section 3 of part NN of chapter 57 of the laws of 2008
         relating to authorizing the New York state mortgage agency to transfer
         certain moneys, in relation to the  use  of  surplus  funds  from  the
         greater Catskills flood remediation program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 3 of part NN of chapter 57  of  the  laws  of  2008
    2  relating  to  authorizing the New York state mortgage agency to transfer
    3  certain moneys, as amended by section 1 of part B of chapter  2  of  the
    4  laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
    5    S 3. (A) Within the amounts transferred to the corporation pursuant to
    6  section  one  of  this  act  for the greater Catskills flood remediation
    7  program, the corporation shall provide funds to the counties of  Broome,
    8  Chenango,  Delaware,  Herkimer,  Montgomery,  Orange, Otsego, Schoharie,
    9  Sullivan, Tioga and Ulster, upon application by a county and within  the
   10  amounts  available  for disbursement to such county, to enable the coun-
   11  ties to purchase and demolish one or two family  homes  that  have  been
   12  certified  by  the local building inspector and county emergency manage-
   13  ment director, to the satisfaction of the corporation,  as  having  been
   14  subject  to one or more incidents of flooding since April 1, 2004 and as
   15  likely to be subject  to  a  future  flood  incident  that  would  cause
   16  substantial damage thereto. Any application by a county for disbursement
   17  of  funds  under  this act shall demonstrate, to the satisfaction of the
   18  corporation, that: (1) the home is occupied as the primary residence  of
   19  an  owner with a family income of up to one hundred fifty percent of the
   20  area median income as defined by the United States department of housing
   21  and urban development, provided, however,  that  an  otherwise  eligible
   22  home  shall be eligible for purchase under this act if the current owner

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 125                              2

    1  can demonstrate that the home was occupied as the owner's primary  resi-
    2  dence prior to a flood event that rendered the home unsuitable for habi-
    3  tation;  (2) the current appraised value of the home does not exceed two
    4  hundred  fifty thousand dollars and the purchase price for the home will
    5  not exceed the appraised value less the amount of any property  casualty
    6  insurance  or  disaster relief payments received by the owner as compen-
    7  sation for damage incurred in a flood incident; (3) all  recorded  liens
    8  or  other  encumbrances on the home will be released at closing; (4) the
    9  county provides assurances that the home will be condemned and the prop-
   10  erty will be dedicated and maintained in perpetuity for a  use  that  is
   11  compatible  with  open space, recreational, flood mitigation or wetlands
   12  management practices; and (5) disbursements under this section shall  be
   13  limited  to the costs of acquisition of eligible homes, including legal,
   14  appraisal, recording and other transaction costs, and the costs of demo-
   15  lition.  In selecting homes for purchase  pursuant  to  this  act,  each
   16  county  shall give preference to homes with a current appraised value of
   17  less than one hundred fifty thousand dollars and to homes that have been
   18  subject to two or more incidents of flooding since April  1,  2004.  The
   19  corporation shall establish policies and procedures consistent with this
   20  section,  which  shall  include county reporting requirements, and shall
   21  report to the governor, the speaker of the assembly, the temporary pres-
   22  ident of the senate and the director of the division of the budget on or
   23  before December 31, 2008 regarding the implementation of  this  section.
   24  Of the amounts transferred to the corporation pursuant to section one of
   25  this  act,  the  amounts  disbursed to counties pursuant to this section
   26  shall not exceed the  following  amounts:  Broome,  $750,000;  Chenango,
   27  $750,000;   Delaware,   $2,000,000;   Herkimer,   $750,000;  Montgomery,
   28  $750,000; Orange, $2,000,000;  Otsego,  $750,000;  Schoharie,  $750,000;
   29  Sullivan, $3,750,000; Tioga, $750,000; and Ulster, $2,000,000.
   30    (B) ANY FUNDS NOT UNDER CONTRACT OR GRANT AGREEMENT BETWEEN ANY COUNTY
   31  PROVIDED  FOR  BY  THIS  SECTION AND THE STATE OF NEW YORK OR ANY OF ITS
   32  DIVISIONS OR AGENCIES ON OR BY JANUARY 1, 2010 MAY BE USED, UPON A FIND-
   33  ING BY THE CORPORATION THAT SUCH FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE, BY ULSTER  COUNTY,
   34  WHETHER  THE  FUNDS  ARE  ALLOCATED  TO SUCH COUNTY OR TO ANOTHER COUNTY
   35  UNDER THIS PROGRAM, TO PURCHASE HOMES WHICH ARE VALUED AT UNDER $250,000
   36  UPON A FINDING  BY  THE  CORPORATION  THAT:  (1)  THE  HOMES  HAVE  BEEN
   37  SUBJECTED TO SEEPAGE OF WATER INTO THE HOMES EITHER THROUGH THE WALLS OR
   38  FOUNDATION  OF  SUCH  HOME OR WATER OTHERWISE ENTERS INTO THE HOME OTHER
   39  THAN THROUGH PIPES INTENDED FOR SUCH PURPOSE AND (2) THE HOME  IS  SITU-
   40  ATED  WITHIN  TWO  MILES OF AN UNDERGROUND AQUEDUCT OWNED, MAINTAINED OR
   41  OPERATED BY THE CITY OF NEW YORK OR ANY  BOARD,  AGENCY,  DEPARTMENT  OR
   42  BUREAU  THEREOF  AND  IS USED FOR THE TRANSPORT OF DRINKING WATER TO THE
   43  CITY OF NEW YORK. THE REQUIREMENTS ENUMERATED IN PARAGRAPHS ONE  THROUGH
   44  FIVE  OF  SUBDIVISION (A) OF THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY, PROVIDED, HOWEVER
   45  THAT NOTWITHSTANDING THE REQUIREMENTS OF PARAGRAPH  ONE  OF  SUBDIVISION
   46  (A)  OF  THIS  SECTION,  NO  PERSON  OR  PERSONS WHO OTHERWISE MEETS THE
   47  REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL  BE  EXCLUDED  ON  THE  BASIS  OF
   48  INCOME  AND  IT  IS FURTHER PROVIDED THAT THE COSTS OF DEMOLITION OF ANY
   49  HOME PURCHASED THROUGH THIS SECTION ARE AN ELIGIBLE COST.
   50    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend section 3 of part NN of chapter 57 of the laws of 2008 relating to authorizing the New York state mortgage agency to transfer certain moneys, in relation to the use of surplus funds from the greater Catskills flood remediation program
